channel.title: Client compile ~ not working
channel.description: hi i got a client to edit to make my own and when i compile my changes it says java is not reconised , my server works fine but i carnt get it to work this is in it compiler: [code]@ECHO OFF TITLE ELEMENTAL Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.10\bin\java.exe" -cp . *.java pause[/code] runner: [code]@echo off COLOR 09 title BrawlerScape @echo ELEMENTAL Client @echo ----------------------- java -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32 pause [/code] please i need help .. thanks

@jjones10 wrote:

Haha, just help the poor lonely soul =P

item.title: Client compile ~ not working
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

[quote=“jjones10, post:11, topic:244027”]Wickey, go to c:\program files\java
Then look and see what version of jdk you have
i.e. my compiler says @echo off title ******** Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java @echo ******** succesfully compiled! pause

Now where is says "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java

Change the jdk1.6.0_07 to your version of jdk[/quote]I was letting him figure it out on his own.

Read full topic

item.title: Client compile ~ not working
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

Wickey, go to c:\program files\java
Then look and see what version of jdk you have
i.e. my compiler says @echo off title ******** Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java @echo ******** succesfully compiled! pause

Now where is says "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java

Change the jdk1.6.0_07 to your version of jdk

Read full topic

item.title: Client compile ~ not working
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

[quote=“M0D 1ST, post:9, topic:244027”][quote author=Kalphiter link=topic=320391.msg2536887#msg2536887 date=1226791324]

[quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=320391.msg2536667#msg2536667 date=1226784933]
Here is my compiler. I use this for every source I have downloaded and it has always worked for me:

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

right click compile.bat and click edit and paste that in there. I’m not going to guarantee it works, so back up your old compiler before switching…Open up two or something.
[/quote]Is checking for JDK really necessary at all?
[/quote] of course its nessacery… its the main link to compilin[/quote]Um… but it only causes an error and then a lot of posts about shit come in even though they have JDK.

If the classpath and path are set correctly, then there shouldn’t be a need to check for JDK in the compiler.

Read full topic

Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

right click compile.bat and click edit and paste that in there. I’m not going to guarantee it works, so back up your old compiler before switching…Open up two or something.
[/quote]Is checking for JDK really necessary at all?[/quote] of course its nessacery… its the main link to compilin

item.title: Client compile ~ not working
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Here is my compiler. I use this for every source I have downloaded and it has always worked for me:

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

right click compile.bat and click edit and paste that in there. I’m not going to guarantee it works, so back up your old compiler before switching…Open up two or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Client compile ~ not working
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

Instead of java.exe, should be javac.exe(in the compiler)

@ECHO OFF TITLE ELEMENTAL Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.10\bin\java.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Should be

@ECHO OFF title ELEMENTAL Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.10\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Read full topic

compiler:

@ECHO OFF TITLE ELEMENTAL Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.10\bin\java.exe" -cp . *.java pause

please i need help … thanks
